wikitext.*:
'''''noldo''''' (earlier pronounced '''''ngoldo''''' or '''''ŋoldo''''') is a noun meaning "One of the [[Noldor]]" in [[Quenya]] (the Noldor were the second tribe of [[Elves]] of the [[Great Journey]]).<ref name="Names">{{App|Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref>

 [[Image:Noldo.gif|left]]''Noldo'' is also the name in Quenya of the nineteenth letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the third letter of the fifth grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "nasal" consonants and it is the fifth letter in the third series of consonants.  For written Quenya or [[Sindarin]], the third series is used for the ''k''-series, the ''[[Calmatéma]]'' and this letter represents initial '''NG''' or '''Ŋ'''.  In [[Westron]] the third series is used for a variety of consonantal sounds and this letter represents '''NY'''.<ref>{{App|Letters}}</ref>  The Westron name for this letter is '''''Nyé'''''.<ref>See ''[[Alphabet of Fëanor: Numenian, or Westron, Mode]]''</ref>

==Etymology==
The word derives from the [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] [[ÑGOL]].<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, ÑGOL-</ref>
